files.name: Intern Options
files.title: Intern Options
files.subject: Intern Options
files.plain_text:
Randen, please see the below chart for intern options.

Organization
Options
Benefits
Considerations
Link
OSU-Cascades Career Development Center
Find a paid or academic intern.
Find an intern from OSU-Cascades.
Post on an online marketplace called Handshake.
Receive Applications.
You hire the intern directly at a rate set by you and the intern.

For academic interns, you will need to monitor their academic progress.  Further, the unpaid intern has to be the primary beneficiary<https://www.jacksonlewis.com/publication/labor-department-adopts-primary-beneficiary-test-determining-employee-status-interns-students> of the relationship.
https://osucascades.edu/cdc/employers
Youth Career Connect
Find an intern

You hire the intern directly at a rate set by you and agreed to by the intern.

It appears that unpaid is available but the primary beneficiary test still applies.
https://youthcareerconnect.org/views/home-1.php


Micro-internships
Find a project intern
OSU uses a marketplace called Parker Dewey to place and help companies find interns.  It operates like other sites (Fiverr), but has more protections for interns.
You hire the intern directly at a rate set by you and the intern.

At the time of this chart, it is uncertain whether academic internships are an option.  It appears that unpaid is available but the primary beneficiary test still applies.
https://info.parkerdewey.com/hubfs/Micro-Internships-Entry-Level-Hiring-Guide.pdf
OSU-Cascades Co-Lab Student Consultancy
Find a project intern or multiple project interns.t
The Co-Lab's Executive Director provides one-on-on advising and coaching to help clients scope projects and manage them.

The Co-Lab interns perform those projects.
You contract with the Co-Lab for $17/hr, and the Co-Lab pays the intern.  Further the Co-Lab finds interns to match the work and monitors the project.
https://osucascades.edu/co-lab
Capstone Projects
Find an intern or group of interns that do an academic internship
Computer Science Students can build apps and take on projects.
Projects have to be approved by the faculty mentor.  Further, students have to elect to be in the program.
https://eecs.oregonstate.edu/industry-relations/capstone-and-senior-design-projects

Thanks,

Adam Krynicki
Executive Director | OSU-Cascades Innovation Co-Lab<https://osucascades.edu/co-lab>

files.name: OSU-Advantage Accelerator AID Fund - Up to $15,000
files.title: OSU-Advantage Accelerator AID Fund - Up to $15,000
files.subject: OSU-Advantage Accelerator AID Fund - Up to $15,000
files.plain_text:
Dear OSU-Cascades Faculty and Staff,

I'm emailing to inform you of an internal funding opportunity.


  *   Amount: Up to $15,000
  *   Application Due Date:  September 17, 2021 at 5 PM
  *   Scope:  Projects in any discipline that will move OSU-owned technologies closer to commercialization.
  *   Additional Benefits:
     *   Get help with protecting the intellectual property (Patent, copyright, etc.)
     *   Join a cohort of other faculty to learn how to commercialize the technology
     *   Test your go-to market strategy before you invest significant time and resources
  *   Other Requirements:
     *   Must be OSU owned intellectual property (which means an invention disclosure and intellectual property assignment is needed)
     *   Must do an interview at the end of September
     *   Must agree to take part in the OSU-Advantage Iterate program in October
  *   More information:  https://advantage.oregonstate.edu/advantage-accelerator/funding-opportunities/aid-fund
  *   PDF of the application questions:  https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zXuH8NlVVbJAHL4IRDdtat5jqcCzcbNT/view
  *   Application Form:  https://forms.gle/RaburoBQvKqxT3Y37

I encourage you to reach out to Katie Pettinger at kathryn.pettinger@oregonstate.edu and Molly Arnold at molly.arnold2@oregonstate.edu from OSU-Advantage if you have questions.

Also, if you would like help with preparing your application or preparing for the interview, I'd be happy to assist. Please feel free to find a time to discuss.<https://krynicki.youcanbook.me/>

Thank you,

Adam Krynicki
Executive Director
OSU-Cascades Innovation Co-Lab<https://osucascades.edu/co-lab>

Dear OSU-Cascades Faculty and Staff,

I’m emailing to inform you of an internal funding opportunity.

  • Amount: Up to $15,000

  • Application Due Date: September 17,2021 at 5 PM

  • Scope: Projects in any discipline that will move OSU-owned technologies closer to commercialization.

  • Additional Benefits:

    • Get help with protecting the intellectual property (Patent, copyright, etc.)

    • Join a cohort of other faculty to learn how to commercialize the technology

    • Test your go-to market strategy before you invest significant time and resources

  • Other Requirements:

    • Must be OSU owned intellectual property (which means an invention disclosure and intellectual property assignment is needed)

    • Must do an interview at the end of September

    • Must agree to take part in the OSU-Advantage Iterate program in October

  • More information: https://advantage.oregonstate.edu/advantage-accelerator/funding-opportunities/aid-fund

  • PDF of the application questions: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zXuH8NlVVbJAHL4IRDdtat5jqcCzcbNT/view

  • Application Form: https://forms.gle/RaburoBQvKqxT3Y37

I encourage you to reach out to Katie Pettinger at kathryn.pettinger@oregonstate.edu and Molly Arnold at molly.arnold2@oregonstate.edu from OSU-Advantage if you have questions.

Also, if you would like help with preparing your application or preparing for the interview, I’d be happy to assist. Please feel free to find a time to discuss.

Thank you,

Adam Krynicki

Executive Director

OSU-Cascades Innovation Co-Lab

files.name: OSU Accelerator August News
files.title: OSU Accelerator August News
files.subject: OSU Accelerator August News
files.plain_text:
AID Fund Open, Tech Funding Opps, Job Opportunities, and more

View this email in your browser (https://mailchi.mp/6cf76c678b91/august2020-7258149?e=c2a3fbe3af)
https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=9cfe415e06&e=c2a3fbe3af


** The Highlights
------------------------------------------------------------
* Accelerate Innovation Development (AID) Fund (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=49fddb9a47&e=c2a3fbe3af) Request for Proposals - OPEN!
* Fall Accelerate application (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=49cba2ea93&e=c2a3fbe3af) - OPEN!
* Business Oregon's SBIR/STTR Matching Program (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=ec4e688049&e=c2a3fbe3af) is re-opening in early September--keep reading for more funding opportunities
* Next month's Fuel 2021 Conference (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=b8b4fcd53a&e=c2a3fbe3af) will offer a session specifically for women taking university technologies to commercialization
* Find funding opportunities from Bayer, Sony, and a Casting Call to be on the Next Great American Entrepreneur listed below


** Accelerator Programs
------------------------------------------------------------
https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=73fdbc4621&e=c2a3fbe3af
The Accelerator is currently seeking technology-based projects in any discipline that will move OSU-owned technologies closer to commercialization. Projects should require $15,000 or less of Accelerate Innovation Development (AID) funding to achieve an important milestone(s) connected to commercialization. Request for proposals begins on Monday, August 23rd and ends Friday, September 17th at 5pm, with interviews taking place the following week. Award decision will be made by Monday, September 27, 2021.

Applicants are highly encouraged to contact the OSU Advantage Accelerator office prior to applying.

Learn more and apply! (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=ba9e28e31a&e=c2a3fbe3af)


** https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=67c15f2524&e=c2a3fbe3af
Fall 2021 Accelerate Application Now Open!
------------------------------------------------------------
Accelerate is a 9-week program open to community members and OSU researchers, students and staff who intend to establish a privately held, high-growth entrepreneurial venture. This program focuses on developing a minimal viable product and engaging in customer discovery to validate your product market fit.

The next session of Accelerate will be a condensed, remote program that meets every week for nine weeks, starting Tuesday, October 5th. Each session runs for two hours from 3pm-5pm.

Application deadline: Friday, September 24th. Apply now! (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=cd0cccae62&e=c2a3fbe3af)


** Funding Opportunities
------------------------------------------------------------


**
Bayer's Grants4Ag Open Until August 31st
------------------------------------------------------------
For the 2021 Grants4Ag submission period, Bayer is partnering with Halo (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=757f4b2707&e=c2a3fbe3af) , a marketplace that helps companies connect with scientists through an intuitive, streamlined interface. The deadline for faculty to apply to Bayer's prestigious Grants4Ag program is approaching on Tuesday, August 31. Grants4Ag is one of the primary ways Bayer identifies long-term research partners.

Application and additional info. (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=bbaaf7fd8b&e=c2a3fbe3af)


** Business Oregon's $50K - $100K SBIR/STTR Matching Program re-opening in early September
------------------------------------------------------------
Federal SBIR/STTR funding is a great source for early-stage companies, but it is not enough to help a company stand on its own. Business Oregon's matching grants provide funds to help fill gaps in what the federal grant will cover and assist businesses build on projects and advance new technologies.

Look for the announcement from Business Oregon (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=53f9fac768&e=c2a3fbe3af) soon!


** Sony Faculty Innovation Award provides up to $100K
------------------------------------------------------------
Global research and development at Sony enables them to foster innovative ideas, which could ultimately lead to future technology advancements and company growth. In order to speed up and expand the creation of new ideas, Sony wants to partner with universities. This partnership will help cultivate advanced concepts and fertilize research and development.

The application deadline is Wednesday, September 15th. Additional information and submission guidelines. (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=f8b18bcf26&e=c2a3fbe3af)


** 35 Mules is accepting applications for its second cohort
------------------------------------------------------------
35 Mules is an innovation hub powered by Florida Power & Light (FPL) Company, a NextEra Energy, Inc. company – a world leader in renewable energy. The mission at 35 Mules is to help entrepreneurs in the energy, technology and energy-adjacent (a purposefully broad category) industries bring their game-changing ideas to life faster, smarter and at scale. The program provides startups with a $100,000 non-dilutive cash grant, unlimited access to leading subject-matter experts, one-on-one coaching from FPL and NextEra Energy Fortune 200 executives, and dedicated, rent-free workspace for 12 to 18 months.

Learn more and apply here (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=e968c35500&e=c2a3fbe3af) .


** Upcoming Events & Programs
------------------------------------------------------------


** US Army STTR Industry Day
------------------------------------------------------------
The Army STTR program will host a virtual “Industry Day” on September 1st-2nd. This event is intended to facilitate small businesses and researchers meeting to potentially partner on STTR proposals. The event will include:
* Plenary speakers
* Q&A sessions with topic authors
* Networking opportunities.

Register to attend (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=ac3202ebb2&e=c2a3fbe3af) . (Note that all event times are listed in U.S. Eastern Time)


** https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=a894ac09d5&e=c2a3fbe3af
OHSU and OCTRI Offering Free Program
------------------------------------------------------------
Based on the National Science Foundation’s Innovation Corps (I-Corps) program, the premier federally-funded innovation and commercialization training in the U.S., BIP Corp provides biomedical scientists, clinician scientists, and engineers with a new approach to accelerate the translation of discoveries from lab to clinical practice. This free 5-week course will help you connect with potential customers for your research project, protocol, service, or prototype.

Non-OHSU participants welcome. No cost to participants. Apply here (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=236eaef148&e=c2a3fbe3af) by Friday, September 3rd.

https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=fae1e47e65&e=c2a3fbe3af


** Women Taking University Technologies to Commercialization
------------------------------------------------------------
VertueLab's twelfth annual Fuel event (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=c1146c9a10&e=c2a3fbe3af) is offering a session focused specifically on women taking university technologies to commercialization. This session will paint the landscape of taking technology research from the lab to commercial markets. Spotlights will include tenacious women entrepreneurs, innovators, and university researchers who will provide insights into:
* Defining commercializing potential
* Fundraising
* Grant management
* Licensing and intellectual property registration
* Many other business development needs.

Also joining are early-stage funding experts to provide their insights into different funding opportunities including: federal funding for research & development (SBIR/STTR), national lab resources, university funding, and the National Science Foundation Innovation Corps (NSF iCorps) Program.

This session takes place on Monday, September 13th from 12:00-1:00pm. Register for this free virtual event and explore other session topics here (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=4dbf7f9034&e=c2a3fbe3af) .


** OSU's Summer Undergraduate Research Symposium
------------------------------------------------------------
This year's summer undergraduate research symposium will take place virtually on September 13th-14th. This annual showcase provides students from all academic disciplines the opportunity to present their research, scholarship, and creative projects to the broader university community. Highlights include:
* Live 10-minute plenary talks given by select students via Zoom during the course of the event, register here to get the link.
* 3-minute lightning talk videos created by each presenter about their work
* A Canvas page distributed to OSU community members who will be able to view presenters’ recordings, ask questions, and engage in dialogue via the Canvas discussion board function. 

Students interested in presenting can sign up to do so here (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=302fb09575&e=c2a3fbe3af) , applications close August 20th. OSU community members can register to attend the event up until September 12th here (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=4d2f1bbc41&e=c2a3fbe3af) .


** Additional Opportunities
------------------------------------------------------------


**
Prototyping Space in the Mid-Willamette Valley
------------------------------------------------------------
Rogue Makers (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=236a3dc926&e=c2a3fbe3af)  is a dedicated facility that hosts multiple small manufacturing-based companies in the Willamette Valley. They have shared tooling resources including TIG/MIG welders, a milling machine, drill presses and light fabrication areas in the all-inclusive monthly membership fees, starting as low as $350/month. They offer dedicated spaces for each company with either secure offices, open shop areas or open cubicles ranging from 100 to 500 square feet. Each company's need is unique, so Rogue Makers adapt spaces as needed.

Learn more about this opportunity (http:// https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=6a18e0919f&e=c2a3fbe3af)


** https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=be4ea74e04&e=c2a3fbe3af
Now Casting the Next Great American Entrepreneur
------------------------------------------------------------
The casting team at Warm Springs Production is currently seeking the next great American entrepreneur for an exciting new television competition series. Production is tentatively scheduled to take place this October, and they are currently casting aspiring entrepreneurs who want to see their idea, invention, prototype or new business reach new heights. Candidates will have an opportunity to gain valuable knowledge and first-hand experience from one of America’s most successful entrepreneurs and potentially secure the funding they need to see their new business succeed.

Apply here (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=834785fb64&e=c2a3fbe3af) or reach out to the casting producer (ashleyholt.tv@gmail.com (mailto:ashleyholt.tv@gmail.com) ) with additional questions.


** Open Positions
------------------------------------------------------------


** Multiple Positions Open at xBiologix
------------------------------------------------------------
Advantage Accelerator affiliate company xBiologix (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=276238924e&e=c2a3fbe3af) , Inc. is hiring! They have multiple openings including:
* Protein Expression and Purification Scientist (2 openings)
* Immunoassay Development Scientist (2 openings)
* Diagnostics Business Development Associate (2 openings)

Find out more on Handshake (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=65494599fc&e=c2a3fbe3af) .

============================================================
** Facebook (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=e7fbbff4a0&e=c2a3fbe3af)
** Twitter (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=e0f50d4955&e=c2a3fbe3af)
** LinkedIn (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=5161713a8c&e=c2a3fbe3af)
** Website (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/track/click?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=f961009cad&e=c2a3fbe3af)
Copyright © 2018 OSU Advantage Accelerator, All rights reserved.
We consider you to be a friend of the Accelerator.
Our mailing address is:
OSU Advantage Accelerator
1110 NE Circle Blvd
Corvallis, OR  97330

** unsubscribe from this list (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/unsubscribe?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=c2e50fc02b&e=c2a3fbe3af&c=f760f80954)
** update subscription preferences (https://oregonstate.us8.list-manage.com/profile?u=74da4632e9a63776f9dd3b6a5&id=c2e50fc02b&e=c2a3fbe3af&c=f760f80954)


This email was sent to i7z7x0u9w6y3p7r3@co-labconsultancy.slack.com (mailto:i7z7x0u9w6y3p7r3@co-labconsultancy.slack.com)
